comments.html: Thanks for the info. I tend to focus on products that my typical readers would be willing to deploy in production networks, but it's always great to know what's out there. BTW, do they have their own ASICs or do they use EZChip?
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Sorry for the late reply. They do have their own ASIC. In the coming high 4th generation ASIC, it will fully support OF1.3.
comments.name: Unknown

comments.html:
Hi Ivan, good summary. But it seems you missed one important SDN switch player, CentecNetwors.
it has its own switch silicon. In all the ASIC powered openflow switch, maybe Centec's is a little
outstanding comparably. It can support 32K 5-tuple L3/L4 flows or 32K 5-tuple L2 flows.
Also it can rewrite ipda/ipsa/L4DstPort/L4SrcPort in addition to rewriting other fields.
You can visit http://www.centecnetworks.com/en/Main.asp for more info. Sorry for the Ad post.
Just want to provide you some info in case you are not aware.
comments.name: Unknown

comments.html:
Hi Ivan,

The HP 5500 switch also presents two tables. Both the 5500 and 5900 can support multiple tables because they support OF 1.3
comments.name: Umair Hoodbhoy
